content.label:
The graphics are great!
The levels are challenging!
As long as you can step to the best, then you are able to sneak your way to the end. I find that even though I have best all of the levels, I‚Äôll go back and replay them for fun.

My only comment is I want more!‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Alright, so the devs saw the game wasn‚Äôt working on XR and fixed it. 

So I‚Äôm here to fix that one star into 5. 

Game is one of a kind and needs to, at least, be experienced once. 

Good to have it back and playable.

title.label: can't play game on new phone

content.label: using the iPhone XR. when I open the app it just freezes on the simogo logo screen and doesn't let me play

The good: Clever level design. You can make the game as easy or hard as you want, because it's up to you how many collectibles you go after each level. It's hard and yet not frustrating , a balance that few games are able to achieve.

The bad: Very little really. You could say that the music isn't the greatest.
Not at all what I hoped for. Very annoying in fact.

title.label: One of my favorite classic games

content.label: I'm so happy this has been updated to new phone sizes as well as 64-bit. This is one of my absolute favorite games; it was one of the first to take a one-tap style of gameplay and make it really good. The rhythm puzzle mechanics, the music, the art style: All of it is delightful. Get it and enjoy.

title.label: Make sure your ringer isn't silent

content.label:
I originally published a one-star review that complained of no sound, even though my volume was maxed, my ringer was maxed, and I could play other audio just fine.

It was fixed by switching off the vibrate switch, which I didn't realize was enabled. When the game says "sound must be switched on," it means it. 

I'll update this review with my impressions later.
A favorite classic ios game of mine. Awesome sound, amusing gameplay, cute graphics. All around great rhythm game.
Makes all other rhythm games look like pong.
Something wrong with this game it doesn't work

title.label: Does not work on iPad Pro

content.label: I have used this on older devices, but get no further than the developers splash screen on iPad pro
I wouldn't have got it if I knew you had to have sound on. Dislike the whole idea of moving to the beat. Waste of money.
Cute design style. A pretty cool musical experience.

title.label: The best game I've played in awhile!!!!

content.label: Yo this game is tight if you ever make a second game you should put actual songs/ beats now that would be dope!!!!

title.label: Art of Theft meets Rhythm Heaven

content.label:
Props to this game for actually revolving around rhythm and not "hit the buttons as fast as you can!!!" 
The art style is fantastic, the music is fantastic, everything's great, my only qualm is that there aren't any other rhythm games on this level of quality on the App Store.
I took a chance on this one because I don't like puzzle games and now I totally need my money back
Bouncing along to the beat as I sneak around. It's the best

This is a horrible game. I don't see the allure to this game at all. I took a chance at 2.99 and now I want my money back.  Tap to the beat to move?  Might appeal to some but I don't believe at all this appealed to so many positives.  I couldn't get past 5 minutes of this game. I spent so much time trying to move to the beat and watching the beat drum, than anything else.  How is this fun? It is not. Horrible gameplay and horrible idea for a game. Ignore all the positive reviews that are obviously false.
Amazingly fun game. Simple controls and mechanics and awesome visuals. Needs a sequel ASAP!

This is an excellent game as far as game play and production value. It also doesn't have in-app purchases, thankfully. 

But I'm not sure why there's so many five star "omg" reviews. 

As a puzzle game it's painfully tedious, repetitive, and annoying. 

As a rhythm game it's boring and simplistic. 

After beating the first puzzle, I was disappointed to realize that it's essentially the same tune over and over. Throughout the entire game. 

Meaning the rhythm game part doesn't really change in difficulty, just the puzzles. 

Honestly the rhythm aspect is more of a gimmick than really incorporated into the game. 

Three stars because the production value is top notch and I love there's not IAP. I don't regret buying just not sure why everyone swears by it.

title.label: You won‚Äôt be sorry you downloaded this

content.label: It is completely addictive. If you like music, wackiness and video games. DOWNLOAD THIS! :)

Although this game's repetitive music can get annoying, this is a must buy for people who enjoy rhythm games, puzzle games, and platformers! I had my doubts at first about this, "$3 for a game? Ain't nobody got time for that!" Was my original thought, then I looked on youtube for the first few levels, and the game actually looked interesting! I had decided that since I've had these $4 on my account for so long, might as well use it! Not the best money I've spent on a game (cause this is my second favorite game) but it was worth it three times over :)
This game is so creative and so much fun.  There is truly nothing else like it out there.  Which is why: we NEED more levels!!  Please?

name.label: C R O N U S T I T A N

content.label: I have iPod 5 and iPhone 5 and it doesn't fit right on them so please optimize it for iPod 5 and iPhone 5 .
Must have

title.label: An Innovative Title that is Executed Superbly, but Needs iCloud Saves!

content.label: A wonderful combination of stealth, rhythm, and platforming, but the biggest letdown of any universal app is no iCloud support, especially a level based experience such as this! Please add this important feature in Simogo!
Very cool like how it was made
I love this game. My friend recommended it to me because she got it from top charts. I love it but I wish you could play it without sound.

The beat based control scheme isn't interactive or fun. It's a stilted attempt to add complexity to a pretty standard 2D puzzle game. Once you visualize the route that will allow you to collect all the clocks and clear the level, executing the pattern in time with the looping samples is just painful.
I thought I had rhythm, but this game continues to challenge that belief! Creative and interesting.

It took me 3 hours to defeat duke in the finale. I enjoyed the joy of success.
The game has great art design, which is a guarantee of simogo. For me the game is challenging but not too hard, and kept me playing.
The vacuum bluster is cute!
I like this game! It kinda hard for me to tap to the beat sometimes, but i enjoy solving the puzzle! Recommend to everyone!
This game is awesome. So much fun for just a minute or even an hour. Great pick-me-up when you just need something quick to play and only have a couple of minutes to spare. Highly recommended!

title.label: Best rhythm I've played in awhile

content.label: This game is totally worth it's money. Tap to the beat to sneak around and avoid the obstacles. You never know what the beat will be like but it's a nice challenge to adapt and move at the right times. If you want an entertaining rhythm based game, this is one of many great ones üòÉ
The game is great; definitely worth $3.  I hesitated initially because the game isn't optimized for iPhone 5, but it's really not a problem at all and isn't noticeable.

I am a big fan of the game and it is worth buying. It even has replay value which is a big thing in the gamin community. I love the on beat controls and it helps stimulate brain activity. I personally love the music that plays when Duke appears and his boss battle music.I recommend this to anyone and everyone.

I don't like most puzzle games, so i was taking a chance in downloading this, and I lost that bet. I found the game annoying well before i got to the point of having to repeat levels. you can't move quickly because you can't move on, say, eighth or sixteenth notes - it's quarter notes or nuthin'. the graphics are all angular - kind of impressionist-style, i guess - which I don't think is pretty, everything's jerking around to the beat, and the music's not innovative or interesting, which is a kinda big shortcoming in a music-based game.

the game's great for some people, i guess, but it just got on my nerves. I deleted it after attempting the third level.
Controls in this game are simplistic and frustrating.  Have to say I'm feeling quite swindled at having paid $3 for this.  Don't make my mistake...

title.label: Very well done but can get annoying

content.label:
At first I loved this game but after you get to the harder levels you have to keep replaying the same level over and over. This normally wouldn't be a problem but since the songs are just 10 second clips repeated over and over it will make you go crazy. And turning off the music really isn't an option because you're supposed to move to the beat of the music.. 

I don't think it's that hard to play the game (moving to a beat) however I was in band for 6 years so that may be why. 

All in all it's a really fun and unique puzzle game IF you can keep a beat and don't mind listening to 10 second music clips over and over.

This game is fantastic, certainly worth 3 greenbacks. However, it would look stunning with retina support, which it doesn't have. I realize that games like this are hard to upgrade resolution-wise, but I can dream.

title.label: Awesome! And a sound fix suggestion

content.label: Love the game! If your iPad suddenly does not have sound on this game, which happened to me, tap your home button twice to bring up the tools at the bottom of the screen, scroll all the way to the left and be sure your mute is not selected. This happened to me and I blame my kid. Now, back to sneaking!
This game is not for black people.
Thumbs up
Love this game

I have never posted a bad review. 
Well today is the day.  
This game stinks. 
Do not buy it!!!!!
Very fresh and addictive gameplay. Really like it

Just beat the game, while collecting all the clocks in every stage.. And you give me a *spoiler alert* remix stage?? The developer of this game sure knows how to make a complete game. I am so grateful I was able to play such an entertaining game at 2.99 only. I would gladly (well, maybe not gladly) pay 5 bucks for the sequel! Keep up the good work guys! i will be so waiting for another sneaky action!
Sound does not work on iPad 3 which defeats the purpose of the game.  Developer website offers no solution.  Very disappointed.
You will repeat levels over and over and over. An you'll hear the same monotonous music because YOU HAVE TO. Deleted after 2 worlds.

title.label: Fun game, the kids love it!

content.label: Fun game, the kids love it!
